case_title: Messrs MAPLE LEAF CEMENT FACTORY LTD LAHORE vs COLLECTOR OF SALES TAX, FAISALABAD
appellant: Messrs MAPLE LEAF CEMENT FACTORY LTD LAHORE

accussed_details.name: N/A
allegation: Irregular timing of input tax adjustment
Disallowance of input tax for non-taxable activities

complaint_summary: The appellant was accused of wrong adjustment of input tax paid on electricity bills for Phase-II against the output tax of Phase-I, violating section 8(4) of the Sales Tax Act, 1990. Additional tax and penalties were proposed for procedural lapses and disallowance of input tax for non-taxable activities.
investigation_summary: The Additional Collector issued a show cause notice and passed an order-in-original imposing penalties and additional tax. The appellant contested the decision, citing procedural lapses and legal clarifications issued by the Central Board of Revenue.
judgment_summary: The Tribunal accepted the appeal, holding that the appellant was justified in adjusting input tax for Phase-II against Phase-I after the cancellation of the second registration. Procedural lapses in timing of input tax adjustment and disallowance of input tax for non-taxable activities were deemed inadmissible.
punishment: Penalties and additional tax imposed by the adjudicating officer were deleted.
Decision_or_verdict: Appeal accepted. Adjustment of input tax allowed.
legal_arguments: Clarification by CBR through Sales Tax General Order No. 10/1998
Procedural lapses in input tax adjustment timing
Input tax adjustment for electricity consumption within factory premises

input_tax_adjustment.phase_ii_vs_phase_i: Adjustment of input tax from Phase-II against output tax of Phase-I was deemed lawful after clarification and cancellation of second registration.
input_tax_adjustment.timing_of_adjustment: Adjustment of input tax before payment of electricity bills was considered a procedural lapse and not penalized.

key_issues.non_taxable_activities: Input tax on electricity consumed in canteen and administrative offices within factory premises was allowed as integral to business operations.

penalty_and_tax.additional_tax: Rs. 65,191 deleted due to procedural lapse in timing of adjustment.
penalty_and_tax.penalty: 3% penalty deleted for wrong adjustment of input tax.

legal_terms.Input Tax: Tax paid on purchases used in taxable activities.
legal_terms.Output Tax: Tax collected on sales of taxable goods.

words_and_phrases.Procedural Lapse: An error or omission in following prescribed procedures.
words_and_phrases.Taxable Activity: Activities subject to sales tax under the law.

clarifications: CBR Letters No. 1(13)STR/2000 dated 10-12-2002 and 1(13)STR/2004 dated 9-12-2004

summary: The appeal was accepted, allowing adjustments of input tax for Phase-II against Phase-I and input tax on electricity consumed in non-taxable activities within factory premises. Procedural lapses in timing of adjustments were not penalized.
summary_vector_notes: The case revolves around the adjustment of input tax paid on electricity bills for Phase-II against Phase-I output tax. The Tribunal ruled in favor of the appellant, citing procedural lapses and legal clarifications. Penalties and additional tax were deleted.
